resources.string:
PURPOSE AND BACKGROUND

 Dr. Pamela Reinagel at the University of California, San Diego is conducting a research study to learn about how people make snap decisions based on ambiguous sensory cues. You have been invited to participate because you are a healthy volunteer, 18 years old or older, with normal or corrected vision and hearing. There will be approximately 100 volunteers in this study.

 PROCEDURES

 If you agree to be in this study, data from any tests you complete within this app, including any you have already completed, will be anonymously uploaded to our data server for research analysis. The uploaded data will be limited to: the time of each attempt, ambient light level, stimulus shown, response made, and reaction time. You do not have to do anything extra to participate in the study. You can continue to perform self-tests at any time, for any duration, just as if you were not participating. Your data will be automatically uploaded to our server when your device has wireless connection to the internet. Your participation lasts until you choose to withdraw or the study ends. There will be no cost to you for participating in this study. There is no compensation for participating in this study.

 RISKS AND INCONVENIENCES

 Participation in this study may involve some added risks or discomforts. These include the following:

 1.\vThere is a potential for the loss of confidentiality. To minimize this risk, neither your name nor any other identifying information will be recorded at any time. Your data will be identified only by a unique random code generated on your device, that cannot be traced back to you. Research records will be kept confidential to the extent allowed by law. Research records may be reviewed by the UCSD Institutional Review Board.

 2.\vBecause this is a research study, there may also be some unknown risks that are currently unforeseeable. You will be told if there are any significant new findings affecting your risk.

 BENEFITS

 There is no direct benefit to you of participating. Society may benefit from advancing our understanding of human cognition. In the future this basic knowledge could lead to the development of useful cognitive or clinical tests or training methods.

 QUESTIONS

 The study has been explained to you, and you have had an opportunity to ask questions by contacting the investigator at preinagel@ucsd.edu. If you have other questions or research-related problems, you may reach Dr. Pamela Reinagel at preinagel@ucsd.edu. You may call the Human Research Protections Program Office at (858) 657-5100 to inquire about your rights as a research subject or to report research-related problems. Participation is entirely voluntary. You are under no obligation to take part in this study. You may refuse to participate or withdraw at any time without jeopardy.

 CONSENT

 You will be able to view this document again at any time within the app. Clicking “Yes I consent to participate” will server as your signature, indicating that you have read this information and you agree to participate:
